meanings.definition: To write or transliterate (a language) in the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: I will romanize this text into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent2: She decided to romanize the ancient script for easier understanding.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to romanize the foreign words for fun.
meanings.sent4: His goal was to romanize the language, bringing it closer to the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent5: The software can romanize any language quickly and accurately.

meanings.definition: To convert (text) into the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: They needed to romanize the document for the international audience.
meanings.sent2: The translator will romanize the text for better readability.
meanings.sent3: In a rush, she had to romanize the message before sending it.
meanings.sent4: The challenge was to romanize the ancient manuscript without errors.
meanings.sent5: He used a tool to romanize the text efficiently.

meanings.definition: To make (a language or writing system) more closely resemble or conform to the Latin alphabet.
meanings.sent1: The linguist worked to romanize the dialect for research purposes.
meanings.sent2: They decided to romanize the language to facilitate communication.
meanings.sent3: The project aimed to romanize the writing system for clarity.
meanings.sent4: Her mission was to romanize the language, making it more accessible.
meanings.sent5: The goal is to romanize the text while preserving its original meaning.
